Besides BF1942, Day of Defeat is one of the best class-based WWII shooter. It has a perfect balance between tactics, teamplay and all out shooting.

This game is straight forward and is an excellent online FPS game.
The player control of the models and guns is tight - extremely tight. It feels seamless between one's choice of movement and the actual gameplay. In this sense you feel in complete control, and thus the behaviour of your players feels like a true extention of oneself.
The game lends itself well to teamplay with excellent voice over microphone. The sound in the game is very good, and listening is a critical part of playing well.

The Day of Defeat community is extensive and skilled and has produced an enormous amount of modified material. There are tons and tons of player that created custom maps which are equal in quality to the core of 20 stock maps which come with the game.

Even though this game came out a long time ago, there's still a lot of active servers worldwide.The skill level of the player base is fairly high, but DoD players are usually well-helpful to new players.
If you like running and gunning in a WW2 environment, you gotta give this game a try. You can also play it offline by installing free bots to learn with.

Day of Defeat? More like, Day of Sniper Nazis. I literally had most frags as a Sniper class. The hitboxes and damage values are sooo broken, that it makes the whole game funny and awesome. Choose Scharfschütze, everyone. It's worth it.

"This is the greatest competitive video game ever created. It's sort of sad because it has better mechanics than counter-strike, but was always CS's red headed step child. Capturing flags, fragging noobs and stomping on bads was the name of the game. Day of Defeat had a tremendous competitive group of people and culture. we attended major and global LAN tournaments for tens of thousands of dollars and talked so much ♥♥♥♥ online you can still hear the echo's of uBad's, KTE's and lolumad's to this day. Day of defeat represented a golden age for competitive online league play. When the unforgivable act that was Day of Defeat:Source came out and destroyed competitive games forever by being so atrocious, it destroyed our beautiful and pure game, that there was never a Day of Defeat: GO as an appology should never go unforgiven. DOD 1.3 is the best competitive game in the history of esports, long forgotten to the likes of realism nerds, over controlling server admins and bad decisions by valve. May the DOD Help Dog never be forgotten, May your k98 be ever accurate and one shot kill, may you prone in corners your enemies will never see. Long live the greatest sport video game on earth, long live Day of Defeat."

I completely agree with this review.

"Day of Defeat" ist ein Online Mehrspieler First-Person Shooter aus dem Jahre 2003.

Der Shooter ist eigentlich - wie Counter-Strike - eine "Half Life" Mod, von Fans erstellt und dann von Valve verbessert und gepublished. Somit ist der Kern des Spiels eine damals herausragende Engine, die sowohl grafisch als auch mechanisch neue Maßstäbe setzte.

Wir sind im Zweiten Weltkrieg und spielen entweder auf Seiten der Alliierten oder der Achsenmächte. Wir suchen uns eine Klasse aus - vom normalen Infanteristen über den MG Schützen bis zum Scharfschützen und Kommandanten ist alles notwendige vorhanden - und kämpfen auf verschiedenen Maps darum, die Oberhand zu gewinnen und Flaggen einzunehmen. 

Das Spiel ist direkt, schnörkellos und relativ schnell. Dennoch sind gute Kartenkenntnis und ein gemeinsames Vorgehen hilfreich für eine erfolgreiche Partie. Sicher ist es aber kein Hardcore-Shooter. Es geht weniger um Realismus als um das kompetetive Spielerlebnis. Und das kann der Shooter auch heute immer noch vermitteln. Es gibt auch noch Server, die besucht werden. So findet man - zumindest zu den üblichen Spielzeiten - eigentlich immer eine Partie. 

Die Grafik ist natürlich nicht mehr aktuell, aber sie funktioniert noch erstaunlich gut. Ebenso ist der Sound nach wie vor gut und auf Zweckmäßigkeit ausgelegt. Alles was wir hören, gibt uns sinnvolle Informationen über die Bewegungen der Mitspieler. Eine Partie "Day of Defeat" macht einfach Spaß und mir - das ist sicher Geschmackssache - auch mehr Spaß als "Counter Strike" und sicher mehr als eine Partie eines modernen "Battlefield" oder "Call of Duty". Denn bei "Day of Defeat" kommt es primär wirklich noch auf Skill an. Jede Klasse ist sinnvoll und hat ihre Stärken und Schwächen. Und auch als Neuling hat man dasselbe Equipment wie die Veteranen.

DoD is old as dirt and it shows. The only ways to play are by making a server or joining a random one and trying to figure out what to do. This game is classic valve so its great but only for the die hard fans who enjoy slogging through clunky menus and graphics to do some decent shooting.
Esse é um jogo incrível, além da jogabilidade e o fator de "quem atira mais rápido ganha", os mapas são muito bons e todos são divertidíssimos, esse é o melhor FPS que eu já joguei.

Davvero una gemma nascosta. Non avevo mai sentito questo Day of Defeat e l'ho preso a pochi centesimi con i saldi. Ho notato una player base ancora attiva e nei server vuoti ci sono di solito i bots che odierete perchè sono davvero fortissimi. L'ho giocato spesso con i miei amici e ci siamo divertiti come matti. Non posso che consigliarlo e sopratutto consigliare il suo seguito in versione Source!

Day of Defeat is an old game but its a fun game...for a few hours you wont be playing this game for too long youll play for 3 hours delete the game and then come back after a month and play 3 more hours it still has players and it has AI support on certain servers from what i could see it has tons of map and quite a lot of guns which is really nice there is two things that i hate about this game which are the AI its either really stupid or it knows where you will be coming from before actually seeing or hearing you which sucks and the other thing is the connection i can only play in empty servers that are filled with AI as soon as anyone joins that server i lose connection and i get kicked that sucks i dont know why i dont know how online connections work but that really does suck

+quite a lot of guns
+Americans,Germans and British all with their own guns
+many maps and they are all good
+its fun for a few hours after that youll delete the game and then come back 1-2 months later and play the game for a few more hours and you can do that no problem because the game takes up less than 1 GB of space on your computer

-the AI is either brain dead or he knows where you will be coming from before you do so yeah the AI either gets stuck on doors or reads your fuckin mind and im pretty sure that i saw a few friendly fire accidents between the AI i said this in some of my older reviews that  this makes the game feel more realistic but i now realize how stupid that sounds yeah it kinda sucks
-for some reason i can only play with AI on empty servers if anyone else joins that server i automatically lose connection and get kicked idk why idk how idk if its fixable but that really sucks

in the end would i recommend this game ? yes i would i played it for 3 hours and i actually had tons of fun sure i only played against AI which means i either destroyed them or got destroyed (like i said before the AI either gets stuck on doors or it reads your mind knowing where you will be coming from and what you will be doing before you actually do it) and i couldnt play with any people which again sucks but hey playing with the AI isnt that bad if you want a cheap realistic WW2 game then you should buy this game when its on sale you can even gift it to your friends so you and your friends can play together
